definition: complicated/many/in great numbers/abbr. for 繁體|繁体[fan2 ti3], traditional form of Chinese characters
festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]
see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]

sentences.english: Red tape encumbered all our attempts at action.
sentences.chinese: 繁文縟節阻礙了我們爲採取行動而作的所有努力。

sentences.english: The U. S. government just loves red tapes.
sentences.chinese: 美國政府就喜歡繁文縟節，官僚習氣。

sentences.english: Businessmen complain that too much red tape clogs their way.
sentences.chinese: 商人們抱怨太多的繁文縟節阻礙他們的道路。

sentences.english: Friends for life, without unnecessary and overelaborate formalities, only simple and pure.
sentences.chinese: 一生的朋友，沒有繁文縟節，只有簡單純潔。

sentences.english: I've given up trying to get a visa; there is too much red tape involved.
sentences.chinese: 我不想再去搞簽證了，繁文縟節太多。

definition: lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
to judge between right and wrong/to reason things out
to whisper to one another's ear
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: to have no sense of shame/brazen
lit. to kill the chicken to get the eggs (idiom)/fig. to kill the goose that lays the golden eggs
